attributes.title: Standard Yields.
attributes.description:
Mixing chart yields were compared with SAP yields from 01/01/25 - 31/01/2025. 

Mixing chart yields (400g) - 497,839.5

SAP yields                    (400g) - 497,829.5

Variance:                       (400g) - 10loaves.

- It was noted that set BOM yields were realized .
attributes.recommendation:
+ Noted adherence to realization of set yields is encouraged in future.

+ Realization of set yields ensures that revenue targets are achieved.

value: + We always ensure that actual yields are reflected on production records (mixing charts and summaries) and posted on SAP system.
+ We will continue verifying production records to ensure accuracy.
Production records and SAP system (mixing charts and stock analysis) were verified and compared to determine if there was significant variance.
- Matching of production records implies that all bread produced was properly accounted for.
Operations/Production Department
- Ensuring actual bread produced is accurately recorded on production registers and posted on the SAP system.

attributes.title: Mixing chart yield spot check
attributes.description: + A spot check on mixing charts on 12.02.25 (1st shift @6.45am) showed that actual yields were properly recorded on mixing charts and supervisors had verified and counter signed.
attributes.recommendation: + Timely mixing chart recordings is commendable.

value: + Random spot checks at production is always ensured.
- We always ensure that mixing charts are updated promptly for proper accountability.
+ Physical dough in baking tins was counted and quantities verified on the mixing chart records to ensure accurate recording.
- Timely recording of mixing charts was noted implying that ongoing production was accounted for.
Operations/Production Department
- Ensure that yields recorded on mixing charts match that physically produced.

attributes.recommendation: + Timely mixing chart recordings is commendable.

value: + Random spot checks at production is always ensured.

Operations/Production Department
- Ensure that yields recorded on mixing charts match that physically produced.

attributes.title: Stock Count
attributes.description:
Physical stock was verified on 12/02/2025.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -27 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -233 pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: - Strong internal controls noted are commendable.

value: + We will maintain this.
+ We always ensure that stock are properly managed and variations beyond the expected are always surcharged.

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 12.02.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.recommendation: - matching of register balances and proper maintenance of registers is commendable and encouraged.

value: + Proper register maintenance will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure registers are well maintained.

- Maintenance of registers is important and implies that the company is not exposed to asset loss.

- Ensuring matching of item registers.

attributes.title: Stock count

attributes.title: Raw materials weight analysis.
attributes.description: + sampled raw materials weights on 12.02.25 showed that they were of standard weight as required.
attributes.recommendation: - Raw materials weight compliance is commendable.

value: + We always do random weights of raw materials upon receiving.
+ We always sensitize foremen to randomly weigh raw materials upon receipts to ensure they conform to standard weights set.
+ Raw materials were randomly weighed and weights compared to those set to ensure compliance.
+ Raw materials having the right weights is a recipe to achieving standard weight bread.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that raw materials at the branch are of desired weights.

attributes.title: Raw materials weight analysis.
attributes.description: + White flour, ingredients and vegetable oil weighed on 12.02.2025 showed that weights matched those set.
attributes.recommendation: + Raw materials having desired weights is commendable.

value: + We will always sample raw materials weights upon receipts.
+ Foremen are instructed to weigh randomly raw materials upon delivery at the premises to ensure that they have required weight.
+ Raw materials weights were sampled to ensure compliance.
+ Raw materials having right weights implies that the company is not exposed to having substandard items and that quality bread production is assured.
Operations/Production Department
- Ensuring that raw materials are of desired weights.

attributes.title: Raw materials weight analysis.

value: + We will always sample raw materials weights upon receipts.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis
attributes.description:
Dough weight variety sampled: 800CT white.

Set dough dividing weight range: 912g - 916g.

+  25pcs of dough weighed on 12.02.25 during 1st shift showed the following;

Overweight = 3pcs (12%)

Correct weight = 20pcs (80%)

Underweight = 02pcs (08%)

+ The above findings show compliance.
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set dough dividing weights as observed is commendable.

value: + We will always adhere to set standard dough dividing weight policy.
+ Dough dividers are always sensitized on the importance of adhering to set standard dough dividing weights.
+ Dough weights were randomly sampled during ongoing production to ensure compliance.
+ Adherence to set standard dough weights implies that product of desired weight was realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring dough dividing weights adhered to ensure standard bread weight production.

attributes.title: Preventive Maintenance schedule inspection.
attributes.description:
+ Preventive maintenance (PM) at the branch was previously done on 24.01.2025.

+ Records show PM is scheduled quarterly.
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to preventive maintenance schedule is commendable.

value: + PM adhered to as scheduled.
+ Follow ups are always made to ensure that PM is done as per scheduled.
+ Inspection of preventive maintenance records was done to ensure compliance.
+ Timely maintenance of machines and equipment ensures quality bread products. This also prolongs the life of the machinery.
Operations/Production Department
- Ensuring preventive maintenance schedule is in place and effected as per policy.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Bread weights were sampled on 12/02/2025.

+ Several underweight loaves were noted.

 + Below is the tabulated results.
attributes.recommendation: + Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

value: + Several packers planned to report on duty 3rd shift did not show up hence the few present could not pack bread in time and some bread overcooled leading to weight loss.
+ Few packers available during night shift were unable to pack bread as produced and planned hence some bread lost weight.
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+ Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing.

+ Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis
attributes.description:
·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.

·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/01/2025 - 31/01/2025.

  • Bread damages were within the acceptable range.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation: + Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

value: + We will put more efforts to ensure that bread damages are further reduced.
+ We will maintain this trend.

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Having controlled bread damages implies that revenue targets were realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages were controlled and were within the allowed rate

value: + Quality and sufficient baking tins is ensured at the branch.
+ Regular inspection is conducted to ensure baking tins are of right quality and quantity.
+ Inspection of baking tins to check their age and if sets available match branch set production capacity.
+ Quality baking tins checks production damages.
Operations/Production Department
- Ensuring baking tins of right quality and quantity,

attributes.title: Raw material consumption standards
attributes.description:
+ Utto and yeast consumption was analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25 on manual mixing charts and SAP mixing charts and compared to set standards.

+ It was noted that both utto and yeast consumptions was as per set standard consumption recipes.

+ The table below tabulates yeast and utto consumption during the stated period.
attributes.recommendation: + Observed adherence to set standard raw material consumption quantities is commendable.

value: + Raw materials were consumed as per expected.
+ We always ensure that raw materials are consumed as per set standards.

+ 

Standard utto consumption set for the branch is 142.86lt/bag. Standard yeast consumption for all varieties was 125g/bag.
+ Adherence to set consumption quantities checks production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring raw materials are consumed as per expected.

This will be maintained.

+ Timely payments implies that the company is not exposed to losses through bad debts.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
PRODUCTION EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

+  Analysis was done from 01/01/2025 - 31/01/2025. 

+ Production inefficiency was reported with a cost implication of 10,866shs (10production workers were hired in excess)

Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
+Noted operational inefficiency should be addressed.

+ Surplus wage payment due to production  inefficiency should be surcharged.

value: + We will put in measures to ensure set efficiency targets are realized.
+ We will put in stringent measures to address operational inefficiencies noted.
+ This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Production inefficiency noted increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set operational efficiency is realized in line with the company policy.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards
attributes.description: Standard fuel consumption was provided and is provided below;
attributes.recommendation: + compliance to providing set standard fuel consumption is commendable.

value: + Fuel consumption set standards was provided.
+  All standard fuel consumption are provided and reviewed.
+ Motor vehicle mileage register was analyzed to check whether each van has set standard fuel consumption.
+ Providing standard fuel consumption for sales vans implies fuel consumption is properly monitored hence no misuse of fuel and this checks operational costs.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring each sales van has set standard fuel consumption.

attributes.title: Sales vans fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
·           Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/01/2025 – 31/01/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table.

Above findings show fuel under consumption for M/v KCG 428W by 48.54ltrs and fuel over consumption for M/v KBR 682P by 21.38ltrs.
attributes.recommendation:
·          High fuel consumption by sales vans should be addressed.

·          Under consumption should also be explained.

value:
·          Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.

·          Under consumption by the said sales van was due to the van being used elsewhere hence difficult to track consumption while away.

+ High fuel consumption by KBR 682P was due to mechanical issue and this was escalated to transport department.

·          Under consumption of fuel was because the van was being for other assignments and also fueled there therefore mileage will increase hence showing better consumption rate.

+     High consumption was because the sales van is faulty and this was reported to transport/maintenance department.

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.

·           Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs. 

      + High fuel consumption by M/v KBR 682P increased operational costs.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring all sales vans fuel consumption rate was that expected (as per set standard consumption)
